definition: string.split(separator, max_split) separator = what you want to separate by, default is ' ', max split, default = -1 which is everything, 1 is 1 split   RRETURNS A LIST OF ALL Separated bits EX: txt.split(#, 1) = ['a', 'b#c'] when txt='a#b#c'
[start (inclusive): stop (exclusive): step] to use this to reverse a number, you do int(num[::-1])

term: how to get dims of numpy array

definition: if all(x==0 for x in dict.values()), returns TRUE if all items in Iterable are True, else False
Ordered and UnChangeable (No adding, changing, or removing items) t = (1, 'hi', True)
np.random.randint(low, high, size, dtype) low = Inclusive, high = Exclusive, size default = 1, can be matrix (row, col) dtype default = int
input(prompt) print message before getting user input
